title: Will the Sampling Distribution Be Nearly Normal?
question_text: In which of the following situations is it NOT safe to assume that the sampling distribution of ${ \overline { x } }_{ A }-{ \overline { x } }_{ B }$ will be nearly normal?

choices.text:
Samples of $45$ will be randomly chosen from a skewed right Population A.
Samples of $15$ will be randomly chosen from a nearly normal Population B.

Samples of $12$ will be randomly chosen from a skewed left Population A.
Samples of $15$ will be randomly chosen from a nearly normal Population B.

Samples of $45$ will be randomly chosen from a skewed right Population A.
Samples of $55$ will be randomly chosen from a bimodal Population B.

Samples of $17$ will be randomly chosen from a nearly normal Population A.
Samples of $15$ will be randomly chosen from a nearly normal Population B.

Samples of $82$ will be randomly chosen from a skewed left Population A.
Samples of $67$ will be randomly chosen from a skewed right Population B.
